questions.question: She is taller ……………….. her husband.
questions.description: Then is  a time expression than is used in comparative structures.

questions.question: He put the books ………………….. the table.
questions.description: We use in to show position inside three dimensional spaces. On is used to show position on the surface of something.

questions.question: The baby ………………….. his mother.
questions.description: Resemble is one of those verbs that do not take a preposition before its object.

questions.question: The child sat ………………….. his mother.
questions.description: Beside means near or next to. Besides means in addition to.

questions.question: The clown ....................... the audience with his tricks.
questions.description: Amusing is a present participle form. It becomes a verb only when it is used with forms of be.

questions.question: I gave ……………….. chemistry because I didn’t like it.
questions.description: To give up is to stop making an effort and accept that you have failed.

questions.question: I don't know where ......................... gone.
questions.description: In indirect questions, the subject goes before the verb.

questions.question: He is taller than ......................
questions.description: If there is no verb, object pronouns are more common after than.
